description: Tiny gen of a find ramen/sushi place! The restaurant is pretty small. I definitely wouldn't come here with a party over 4. Fairly quick service even the the waiters got confused a few times on which food went to what table. We orders the chicken and tonkatsu ramen, saiwaii roll, and tempura roll. The broth for the chicken ramen was basic nothing too fun about it. The tonkatsu definitely had more flavor. The saiwaii roll was great I would definitely get it again. All in all, I wish they had a bigger assortment to the menu especially the ramen choices. However, I would most likely come back here again for my ramen fix.
author: Mallory B.

description: Awesome ramen. Almost forgot about this place  had the Kong sushi and spicy garlic pork based ramen. All good!
author: Richard C.

description:
Saiwaii is a place where most of my friends go for ramen when it's convenient and because it's reasonably priced (nowadays there has been a lot of competitors for ramen joints in the city!). My first time here was this past Thursday with a girlfriend and this was close to where she lived. It always seems busy when I've walked by here in the past so I wasn't surprised to see most tables filled up when we got here. We were seated immediately upon walking in. They have your basic ramen noodle soup bases (miso, shoyu, vegetarian, tonkotsu) and some special seafood options. We both got their garlic tonkotsu, mines mild spicy each with an egg. Other toppings included are chashu, bamboo shoots and green onion. I would totally agree that this place is just alright but well suited for those who are on a budget and happen to be in the area. Portion sizes are good for the price as ours were roughly $12/bowl egg included. 

They also have sushi rolls if you aren't feeling ramen! And a wide variety of appetizers to choose from.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
If you like your ramen spicy, you'll LOVE Saiwaii! But if you like ramen in general, you'll love Saiwaii anyways. This is probably one of my favorite ramen shops within the SF city area. 

My favorite aspect of Saiwaii is like I mentioned, the spicyness of their ramen. I remembered my first visit I ordered my ramen extra spicy and that was a little too much spice even for me, so on my next few visits I toned down the spice level and it was perfect! Besides the spicyness, the noodles were cooked perfectly each time and the cha chu is always super tender! The only downside I see is that there are a lot of toppings that are extra charge, even an egg. But other than that the ramen itself is among the best!

I also had sushi on a couple of occasions and they were ok. (Of course you can't expect top notch sushi at a restaurant focused on ramen). So all in all, if you want some delicious, spicy ramen, this is the place to be!
author: Marco M.

description:
So glad to have found this place. I was visiting my best friend here in SF and I was just not used to the cold weather that I was craving for a nice warm bowl of ramen. So I asked another friend who is also a local about good ramen shops and she referred me to here since it was close to where my friend and I was. 

This place probably has the best ramen I have had flavor wise because their spicy mala was bomb!! It had chicken karaage, pork, spinach, egg, and nori and it was so gooooooood!! My mouth is watering as I type this review. I loved the broth a lot, it wasn't too spicy but the flavor was just amazing! Our waitress was also very attentive and fast. We were out of here in a flash! It's a very small restaurant so get ready to wait. 

I wish there was something like this place near where I live but at least I know where to go when I come visit SF in the future.
author: Danielle Q.

description: Ramen and sushi?! What more could you ask for. The lunch special that includes both was probably too much food, but it was soo good!
author: Shaena S.

description: This restaurant was just really bad. First of all their Ramen is just plain horrible. From their stale noodles to their disgusting meat. Their Fried Chicken tasted like fat surrounded by fried shit. In the end for 4 people is costed $100. The only reason I would go back is for their adequate sushi
author: Lewis W.

description:
I came here excited to try their vegetarian option ramen.  When we got there, we were seated promptly.  I asked about a vegetarian option and was told they had none.  My heart sank as I stared back at the menu.  The server returned later and told my boyfriend and I that they could in fact make a vegetarian miso broth.  She was just helping out the restaurant and did not know the details.  My stomach is so grateful that she went the extra mile to double check.

The noodles were solid and the broth, although it was a miso broth, was delicious!  It came with a half boiled egg, corn, green onions, fungus mushrooms, bean sprouts... and delicious, scrumptious nooodles... and for a great price!  The BF enjoyed his bowl as well.  I'm happy.  Can't wait to come back when I visit!
author: Mypang T.

description:
The place is noisy when it's rush hours but that should be a given since the place is quite small. I came here w my sister and BF and we ordered spicy garlic tonkatsu (1 mild, 1 extra spicy), regular tonkatsu ramen, fried calamari and spicy wings.

The spicy garlic tonkatsu broth was quite light, contrary to my expectations. The mild spicy doesn't really build up as you eat more of the meal which is usually the case at other restaurants, which was why I asked for mild. But they're not kidding when you say you want mild spicy so if you want that extra kick, just get regular spicy or extra spicy. The extra spicy garlic tonkatsu broth looked red af when it came out and tasted really spicy too. I wish the ramen included 1/2 soft boiled egg but it doesn't. Instead it has seaweed, cha Shu & some other stuff. I have to say the noodles were really good though with nice texture and it tasted fresh.

The tonkatsu ramen is the same except there's no spice or garlic and the broth has more of the pork flavor. It's light and not oily (good). 

The spicy wings were a bit disappointing. It was more sweet than spicy and the wings were quite small.

The fried calamari was one of the best that I've had!
author: Emily L.

description: Small portion ok ramen. Staff wasn't too helpful and attentive.   Its not very clean as we saw food left on table and floor.
author: Janita s.

description: Was looking for a good ramen spot in the sunset and found this gem. Amazing spot! Pretty small and loud. We got there at 5:45 on a Saturday and had to put our name on a wait list. Wait was about 15 min. Service is very quick and friendly! Had the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen (regular) and loved it! Will def be returning and making this a regular sunset ramen spot!!
author: Milena R.

description: It was ok to compare with the price. I got the pork ramen but it was not soft like others ramen.
author: Pinarat S.

description:
I came here on a Monday around lunch time and it was pretty busy. I got the lunch special which came with a regular sized bowl of ramen with a basic roll. I got the tonkatsu with a salmon and avocado roll. Both were delicious but I felt like the broth could have had more depth in it.

The service was wonderfully friendly so I would definitely come back here even if the ramen wasn't the best.

The food came out very quickly and the restaurant was clean.
author: Shelley C.

description:
I'm visiting the Sunset District today from Sacramento, so decided to come here after I stopped by Andytown Coffee Roasters earlier in the day. 

This ramen shop is located on a bustling street with plenty of other shops. It's in a fairly small space with many tables packed inside. When I came for lunch at 1:30 p.m., it was really crowded and I ended up sitting by another table of four with only an inch separating the two tables. You risk your personal space being compromised while dining here if you prefer not to be elbow-to-elbow with another table.

I was told both the Miso and Spicy Garlic Miso Ramen could be made vegetarian, so I ordered the Spicy Garlic Miso Ramen regular which was supposed to be the equivalent of medium spicy. I didn't find it to be spicy at all, so would order it extra spicy if you are looking for any heat at all. I also added an egg and tofu to my ramen.

My ramen was pretty decent and the broth was served at just the right temperature. However, It's hard not to get past the fact that I better not lift my elbow too high while slurping my noodles though or else I might hit this guy sitting next to me. 

This would be a four star review without the cramped table issue, but with that issue hard to ignore, I can't give above 3 stars. 

Come check them out to see for yourself.
author: Regina W.

description: Good local restaurant.  Sushi is average and nothing to write home about. You come here for the Ramen  which is okay. So they have a lucheon special which is $3.00 cheaper then the dinner. I wanted to order a lucheon special to go and I was told I couldn't order it to go and that I had to eat it here. No way to treat a customer. I said really. So I order it for here only to ask for a box to take it out later..Not cool... this turned me off and I've been here many times before, guess I'll go elsewhere.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Came here on a Saturday evening and there wasn't much of a wait. Sat down quickly and the staff were very friendly. Place is a little dark and stuffy warm. Look on the walls for some extra food items. All ramen is $8.95 and comes with meat, bamboo, green onions, mushrooms and seaweed. The food took about 10 minutes to prepare. Pretty standard time and when the food came, it was piping HOT!

I asked for no bamboo in my ramen. When I got my ramen, I instead had no meat... Which is weird. Apparently, the lady took my order wrong. So make sure when you order, you double check that the items you requested out is right. The staff were very apologetic towards this mishap though so it's fine.

Looooveee the Shoyu ramen I had. The broth was flavorful and noodles were cooked perfectly. The meat, however, was not as tender or well marinated as other ramen places. It was also pretty small. Kind of disappointing but the tasty broth made up for it. This place is definitely one of the tastiest Shoyu ramen I've had so far. I also had a taste of the Tonkatsu broth. It was good but I preferred the Shoyu broth more.

I'll definitely be back here for more ramen if I am in the area!
author: Benita M.

description:
Two stars: one for the constant refilling of water and another for the gyoza. 

I'm sorry, but this ramen was gross. I got the garlic miso and the only flavor in it was garlic and not in a good way; the broth had no enduring texture or richness at all. The noodles had a weird, tap-water flavor to them. The chashu was tough and fatty and chewy and flavorless. The aji tama I added to it was also flavorless. The only thing about it I enjoyed was the wakame and that, um...isn't saying much.

I added soy sauce, chili oil, and togarashi and none of it helped. Afterwards, I had a very unpleasant taste in my mouth and two hours of exceptionally unpleasant burps to follow.
author: Julia D.

description:
This review is for its ramen only.

On a windy foggy Sunday night, I was craving for something warm and spicy. Ramen surely sounds good! Happened to be in the Sunset area and found Saiwaii thru Yelp searches.

First off, be prepared for the wait. When I arrived during dinner time that place was PACKED. The waiting area is super tiny (room for 5 people standing max) so if you are the 6th one chances are you will be forced to stand outside under the infamous chilly Sunset weather. Well, hopefully the food would be super good?

Although this place is called Saiwaii Ramen they actually have a wide sushi selection on the menu. Didn't feel like sushi that night so went straight with their signature spicy ramen.

#Spicy Garlic Miso Ramen with Pork Belly and Spinach: B+.
It's warm, it's spicy, I was satisfied. But other than that I didn't find anything spectacular about it. Ramen noodle quality was average - would appreciate if it's more chewy. This ramen bowl came with chashu, menma, corn and some other ingredients. Chashu was not bad - quite tender-ish. I also added Pork Belly per suggestions from fellow Yelpers, although I didn't quite find it impressive. For the broth, I think they did a good job in terms of spiciness but it totally covered the miso part of it.

They probably serve good quality sushi? I don't know. But their ramen totally fits the "A-OK" feeling description.
author: Simon C.

description:
I don't know why Saiwaii only has 3.5 stars because it really is a great place! I have been here at least 4 times and gotten take out twice and each time my experience was 5/5 stars. 

Ramen: I highly recommend! The broth is wonderful, great noodles and it always comes out nice and hot. They have a regular or spicy ramen and I have gotten both but I prefer the regular. 

Sushi: Surprisingly their sushi is very good! I am always satisfied with my roll and the fish is fresh. 

Service: OUTSTANDING. There is one lady always in there, I think she might be the owner but she's always so sweet and welcoming. She works very hard. 

I love this place.
author: Nikki A.

description:
I really wanted to love this place but something was just lacking when it came to the flavor of their broths. I got the tonkotsu ramen and my boyfriend got the spicy tonkotsu ramen and we both had to keep adding things just to give it a little flavor. The pork belly's fat to meat ratio was a bit off compared to other places I've had (obviously poor belly is supposed to have a good amount of fat but I was eating fat with bits of meat here and there...).

We got their lava roll which was fine, nothing spectacular. The service was good. They were kind and very attentive. Which is why we hoped we'd enjoy the food much more. Unfortunately we probably wouldn't go out of our way to come back.
author: Mariacecilia B.

description:
I love love love Sawaii. I've been coming here for years but just haven't gotten around to writing a review. For as long as I've been coming, they've never disappointed me in flavor of their food nor in service. Sawaii is located in outer sunset, and super super small inside so sometimes there's a bit of a wait when you go during prime time. 

My go to ramen is always the spicy garlic tonkotsu. It doesn't come with the delicious ooey gooey soft boiled egg so I pay an extra $1 for it BUT they give you the whole egg and not just half the egg like some other ramen places do. I think Sawaii's soft boiled egg is probably my favorite .... I JUST GOTTA HAVE IT. Perfect ooey gooey yolk every single time. I mean, they give you TWO pieces of this delicious piece of heaven. How can you say no! 
I've also tried their spicy mala ramen - this comes with chicken karaage AND EGG. Even tho the name is spicy mala - you can actually choose the level of spicyness. I think this would be my go to if I'm ever craving karaage with my ramen. They give you about four or five large pieces of chicken on top of two slices of chasu so it's pretty worth getting.

I've had a few items from their apps and sushi menu. Everything is fairly good but I would probably only come back for their ramen because it's JUST DAT GEWD.
author: Ava F.

description:
Why doesn't this place have higher ratings and develop a cult following! Their ramen is pretty darn on point.

Go for the Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen with a choice of mild, regular or extra spicy level. I usually go for regular spicy and I can eat it without having my sinuses run and burn from the heat. It comes with the standard cha shu (sliced pork), wakame, negi, shredded fungus mushrooms, green onions, small shreds of garlic and green onions. Add some corn or an egg for $1 a pop and you've got yourself a $12 bowl of ramen. That's pretty standard price if you want the works and its worth it. It tastes hearty, carby, soup is delicious and ramen al dente. Love it! Good portions as well.

The sushi and sashimi is "mehhhhh", forgettable. 

Service is great! They work really hard to bus tables, seat customers, take orders and run the food. Hard workers here. The restaurnat is well kept and very clean. My go to place to avoid the long lines.
author: Janny S.

description:
*!*!* I'M GIVING THIS PLACE 2 1/2 stars *!*!*


So my friends and I went here after hiking @ Lands End (Awesome place BTW!). 

Well we waited 45 mins for a table! That's why there was a lot of people standing outside. This place is small too. There was only two servers. I don't know if that's normal, but they were going on the slow side. Like when tables would need to be cleaned, it wasn't attended to right away and there was people waiting to be seated. A couple dirty tables had their dishes and stuff removed but then a few mins after that it was cleaned off. It didn't make sense to me. Just clean it all @ once since you have people waiting! On top of that, they don't go in order as to when you put your name down on the list. We had four people and a couple who put their name down after my friend did was seated before us! And it's not like there wasn't a table ready for our group of four either. That made me so mad to see!

So we finally get seated. I don't like how you have to sit right next to someone you don't know. No offense. But it's so small in there, that that's how it is. Then they ask you if you don't mind sharing a table with people you DON'T know! WTH!?!?!?! I have never heard of that ever! 

Getting to our food. It was...okay to good. We order the Chicken Wings, Sunrise Roll, and everyone got different Ramen. We liked the chicken wings, so I would get that. The Sunrise Roll was eh. I've tasted better. My ramen was good. I order the Spicy Mala. I didn't know it came with both fried chicken and pork. I guess that's what Kara age meant. Everyone else I think got the spicy garlic miso. 

I don't think I would come here again. We came here cause it was close to Lands End and we were tired so we thought we could get dinner not right away but not wait 45 mins and then still wait for our food. 

I would skip this place. I'm pretty sure there are more (good) ramen places in SF.
author: Akemi H.

description: This place was awesome! My honey and I are visiting from out of town, and I was on a mission to find some good ramen. This spot is in a nice residential area and there was plenty of street parking around 7 pm. Cozy atmosphere and friendly service. We had the Gyoza (potstickers) for an appetizer. They were so good we gobbled them up before I could remember to take a pic. We both had the spicy garlic tonkotsu-his mild and mine spicy. I love love loved it! Very generous amount for a great price. My best meal in San Fran. Give this spot a try if you can! I will surely return if we visit town again.
author: Felise F.

description:
This place was crowded the day after Thanksgiving. It's one of the few ramen places in the Sunset. Street parking is difficult so plan ahead.

I tried the tonkatsu ramen. It was okay, nothing special really. The broth wasn't very flavorful and was on the soupier side. I also ordered the spicy tuna don but it too was somewhat disappointing. There was an extremely thin layer of something resembling spicy tuna on top of a bed of rice. Not the most appealing, not very tasty, and unfortunately, not filling. 

The spicy garlic soft shell crab was a huge plate. The dish looked big over a plate of salad. The crab had way too much breading and very little flavor. 

Service was good though. With it being so close to home, I just wish the food was better.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Saiwaii is probably one of my favorite ramen places ever. They're fast with getting your order out and the staff is friendly. Their ramen is top quality (I usually go for the Spicy Mala Ramen) and they give plenty in it. 

My only complaint? They seem understaffed. At times, they'll have only one waitress out serving everyone. While they do get to everyone, it takes a while and they tend to forget requests. 

Overall, a great place to eat. Get there early because it fills up quickly!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Amen for ramen. Not raw-men... moving on, Saiwaii Ramen is Irving Street's local ramen joint, found south of 19th Avenue. As an Irving resident, this is my go to spot. I was a little torn to write a review, because I love this place and I'm a selfish mother fucker who doesn't wanna share. But, I gotta do right by this place.
 
Let's talk ramen, this is their bread and butter... or I guess, noodles and broth. Saiwaii has a nice home cooked feel which is hard to find these days in the midst of the ramen popularity boom. Miso and Spicy Miso are a good place to start if you don't know what to get.
 
They also have sushi, their selection might not be as vast as other places. They're not a sushi joint, what do you expect? What you can expect are some delightfully tasty rolls, what Saiwaii lacks in variety, they definitely make up for in quality. Anything with yellow tail here is complete yum.
 
The one thing I will you warn you about is the curry. DON'T FUCKING GET THE CURRY, IT'LL MAKE YOU SAD!



YUMMER SCORE: Food - 8    Service - 7     Experience - 7
author: Ryan M.

description: My favorite spot for ramen in SF! The broths are so tasty and savory and for a price that you can't beat! If you're in the sunset neighborhood, I highly recommend this spot. It's a bit small so try to go during a less busy time. The lunch specials are great for a bowl of ramen and a small Plate of sushi! Love this place!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Service is great and attentive. Had the farthest table and spotted us whenever our waters got even close to half full.

The ramen was decent or better. Lots of flavor in the soup. The spicy miso ramen has a lot of the spicy oil in it, was a bit oily for me.

$1 charge for 2 pieces of cut nori...!!!!!!
Not all ramen comes with eggs!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Not a place I will frequent... however, the tables where full on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I almost forgot I've been to Saiwali a few years back until my recent visit. Saiwali Ramen is your typical ramen spot, they serve the food in your Japanese knowledge-base and nothing can go wrong with it. Everything was good as of the price for ramen so I wouldn't complain. I like it but haven't become a fan just yet.

This place is pretty small, so think twice if you have a large group. The servers were really nice and quick on refilling our hot tea.

2016027
author: Leslie C.

description: Really good spot for Ramen! Coming from the East Bay, I'd go to this spot for Ramen definitely!
author: Fred V.

description:
Out of all the ramen spots in SF, this is at the bottom on my list. I've been here numerous times in the past, and it seems like it's just getting worse.

I usually get the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu, which is a fan favorite here. I think it's just decent. The broth just isn't that flavorful to me, maybe because all the spicy chili oil always overpowers everything.

I came back here last night because my mom was craving for it. I decided to try something new, so I ordered the Shoyu Ramen. The broth lacked a lot of flavor, as expected. I tried some of my mom's Spicy Mala Ramen, which tasted like nothing with a hint of spicy. I seriously don't know why she likes this place.

I've tried many other things here from their sushi to many different appetizers, and none of them were that great.

The service here is always pretty good though, which is the only good thing about this restaurant, sadly.
author: Derek T.

description:
Overall rating: 3.2 

Atmosphere: Pretty small restaurant. I'd so no more than a party of 6 since the dining space isn't huge. The waiter we had was super polite and was attentive to our service. And our food was delivered to us in a reasonable amount of time. We did not have to wait long. 

Food: 
Menu is a reasonable size. They offer appetizers, ramen, udon, different types of donburi, sushi, etc. 
I had the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu with regular spice ramen which came with quite a bit of toppings and they were pretty generous with them. My ramen came with an egg, mushroom, bambo shoots, green onions, garlic chips, chashu & seaweed. The noodles were chewy. Broth was nice and savory but if you like spice, I'd definitely recommend getting the extra spicy because even though my ramen was regular spicy, it wasn't even spicy which was a bit disappointing. 

Reason for my low rating: 
They messed up on two of the orders in my table of 5. They added an egg to two of the ramen's even though it wasn't ordered. When we told them that, one of the other waiters told us that the ramen came with it. But after receiving our receipt, we were charged for it. 
Also the ramen was good but I wouldn't come back regularly for it.
author: Cassidy V.

description:
pretty good food here, especially lunch special with Cali rolls yum!
Normally not too much way time, but overall good food, not too expensive.
author: Marvin A.

description: Found ourselves getting that crazy ramen craving and decided to try Saiwaii Ramen. The line was long, but the wait was fairly short. My partner had the Tonkotsu Ramen with extra egg and it was apparently quite delicious. There definitely are meat-free options, but I went with the Miso broth, which contains a seafood base, so I can't review any of the vegetarian meals at this stage. My Miso Ramen with extra egg might have had a little too much miso in it (or perhaps I just don't eat miso often enough and it was too much for me), so I'll try a clear vegetarian broth (if possible) next time, or I'll ask them to dilute the miso a bit more. The egg was cooked to perfection and the ramen noodles were delightfully tender. Looking forward to trying it again next time!
author: Zoe P.

description:
Came in for dinner around 6pm. They had a table for two available and I was seated right away. I came in to write my name on the list while my sister looked for parking, so I sat by myself at first. The server understood I was waiting for someone before ordering and kindly asked if I wanted drinks while I waited. 

I ordered the spicy garlic tonkatsu in extra spicy and it was spicy! I like spicy and would say I have a good tolerance of heat, so their extra spicy lives up to the name. The broth is rich and not too salty. The noodle to broth ratio is good. The texture of the ramen is perfect - neither too soggy nor hard.

I also ordered the shrimp and veggie tempura appetizer. You can't really get this wrong so I am not going to comment on its taste. What I like is that the dish has two of each item, so it makes splitting between my sister and I simple. 

I took off a star because of the front door. We sat at the table closest to the store front windows, so every time someone opened the door cold air comes rushing into the restaurant and wind blows towards our table. The door does not close by itself and people do not close it after they enter/exit. So it was pretty annoying experiencing cold wind every couple minutes during our meal. The servers notices it and shuts the door when they can. I appreciate the workers who realize this problem and closes the door each time. To avoid this problem altogether, I think they should replace that door with one that closes itself.
author: Shirley M.

description:
This is probably my favorite Ramen house ever. I've eaten ramen all over haven't found one that I like as much as this. The garlic tonkotsu broth is to die for! Such a rich full body flavor. I especially love it spicy. They spice their ramen perfectly. They have perfectly cooked egg and noodles, the Karaage is super yummy, I've even had their sushi which I love. Perfect place for some delicious comforting ramen.

Great services, food comes out quick. Usually a 10-15 min wait to be seated.
author: Buddy J.

description: Still absolutely love this place! I've tried other ramen spots around the city and still nothing can top their spicy mala ramen.
author: Trevor D.

description: Nice local ramen place, with a good decent menu, including rolls and rice.  Staff were friendly but parking can be hard to find.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Aight. 

No fuss chinese-japanese fusion food. Many interesting appetizers on the menu...bacon wrapped mochi?!?!....an unlikely combination but I promise you it works. 

Portions sizes on the smaller end compared to other places but will fill you up. This place is generally for hip youngsters.
author: Anna H.

description:
The best local ramen shop in the Sunset!

Friendly service, nice environment to slurp down some noodles.
author: TC C.

description:
Saiwaii has Swift and elegant service, amazing ramen that had the perfect amount of spicy broth and seafood. The ramen tastes handmade and it will easily become one of your favorite parts of the soup alongside the multidimensional flavors of the broth. I never visit SF without stopping by Saiwaii! 

They have the BEsT LUNCH SPECIALS for $7.95!! They give you salad, rice, 4 sushi rolls, miso soup and your choice of ramen, fish katsu, chicken Kara age or Teriyaki Chicken!!
author: Love L.

description: My friends live a block away from Saiwaii and we finally ate here tonight. We ordered Togo through eat24. I got the pork tonkatsu and chicken wings. The meal was amazing. My friends all got ramen. Everyone was full and happy. Will try eating in next time but make sure you are patient because you will wait 15-30 minutes.
author: Perry S.

description: Came here for lunch on Thursday and ordered the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen with mild level of spice and the sake (salmon) avocado roll. It was their lunch special for a total of 12.95. Ramen noodles were cooked perfectly. Broth was good but a little too greasy for me to want to drink. Chashu was tasty as well. Sake avocado roll just alright. Felt that the rolls were on the smaller side. But it was definitely a filling meal for a very decent price.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
I've tried a lot of different ramen places and saiwaii I would say would have to just be ok.. 

The pricing is normal for a ramen place but I ordered the mild spicy beef tonkatsu ramen and for some reason it tasted more like seafood than beef.

The broth they use is a base for all the other ramen they have on the menu, the spicy level was tolerable and not quite spicy at all. (Mild) 

Bacon wrapped mochi, it is quite different and a must try! It somewhat tastes like a bacon flavored gummy..
author: Jenny S.

description:
Revisited this restaurant after many years of absence... Nah, still hasn't improved at all and my opinion of this restaurant is still the same.  I got the tonkatsu ramen and the broth wasn't as tasty as some of the other ones I've had.  I also got 3 sushi rolls (California, Shrimp Tempura, and Salmon/Avocado).  I wasn't impressed. The sushi rice was mushy and every roll was chewy.  I can't pinpoint why but could it be that the seaweed was not fresh??  

Meh. I've experienced better!
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Came here the other day for lunch with my roommate. We honestly had the grossest experience. First of wall, we ordered the spicy garlic T. Ramen. It wasn't the best ramen I had. I felt it needed more flavor because the spiciness just tasted like I was eating noodles in chili paste and we ordered tuna rolls and California rolls. The server wasn't great. I always had to wave her down because she was never checking up on our table. 

But get this... Before I was going to grab a bite of my tuna roll, I decided to dip my roll into the soup but when I pulled it out, I noticed a Nasty Hair! So I was completely grossed out. I wasn't sure if the hair came from my soup or my roll. But THEN! My roommate was about to take a bite from her sushi roll and she Found a HAIR TOO!!! We told the servers and they only replace 2-3 rolls of the spicy tuna and they gave us back the same plate that we found the hairs on! So we just stopped eating our food after and asked for the bill. Finally when we got the bill you would think they would put a discount or something since we found not one but TWO hairs in our food. We just paid and left. Never coming back!
author: Krystna M.

description:
Dont get me wrong, Sawaii is good but not THATTT good. Ive tried alot of different ramen places around the bay and Sawaii is probably a 2.5 or solid 3 in my book. I come here simply because it's close to my school and I do like it here better than Izakaya down the street.

I have tried their Tonkatsu, spicy miso, spicy mala ramen and sadly I found their soup to be soo bland. I had to put so much chili oil, chili powder or sometimes soy sauce on my soup to make it better. Sigh last time I came here I ordered the Tonkatsu and I literally dumped alot of chili oil on my soup lol it's just not flavorful enough! I also tried their beef tongue and now that was pretty good! My bf and I loved it! 

When I came in today they had a lunch special of ramen with sushi for $10.45 which was a great deal, I left feeling full and satisfied. Service was also great, one waitress was all smiles to the point where it kinda scares me a little bit lol 

I will probably come back since everyone I know loves this place but if they dont mind driving further I rather go to San Mateo or San Jose for the real treat!
author: Debbie D.

description:
The layout of this restaurant is jam packed. They seriously maxed out their space with barely any walking room. If you're with someone in a wheelchair, this can be a problem. 

Super humid inside this restaurant, no air flow.

Ramen is just ok, but on the salty side. The noodles are the skinny straight kind. The egg is done really well. Had the garlic tonkotsu ramen and I had to add egg and corn to it. Blows that the egg doesn't come standard. They forgot my corn but it wasn't even on my bill so the waitress who took my order totally forgot it. 

It'll do if you're  in the outer 'set... but if you're picky about your ramen, keep trekking because this place ain't it.
author: Susy C.

description: it's so hard to find ramen that doesn't have any pork (broth), but saiwaii ramen offers its patrons a pescatarian version, using miso and fish. it satisfies the creamy ramen craving that I could never get. the broth was flavorful and creamy, and the toppings were decent: crunchy corn, bamboo, nori (a bit soggy), green onions, and crunchy garlic. noodles had a good texture, overall a good bowl of ramen.
author: Zara A.

description: It's a typical unpretentious family owned small  restaurant in the mid Sunset. Crowded and often a wait. Not much on atmosphere if that's your draw however their food is well above what you find for the type of place. And inexpensive. I enjoy their ramen much more than all the other "in" ramen spots around the city with the Spicy Miso Garlic a favorite. Although not a sushi restaurant the Maki and other sushi offerings are always fresh and quite good. If ramen isn't your thing they do have a short list of other dishes. The pork katsu donburi we ordered was beautifully presented with lightly battered crispy perfectly cooked pork and just the right proportion of onions, egg, scallions, ginger and sauce on the rice to make it probably the best katsu donburi I have had in SF. The ramen arrives equally as well presented.
author: Steven B.

description:
Used to be good. We drive an hour to eat here occasionally, at least 2-4 times every 2 months. The spicy garlic tonkatsu was our go to every time. But they are not consistent at all. The spice level is off every time. We always ask for regular spicy. Each time it's either too spicy or not spicy at all. I don't get it. How can you make it different every time but the spice level always changes even though we ask for regular? It's really good when they actually put the right amount of regular spice level. Isn't there some kind of measurement they use? How come it's so different every time? Do they just eyeball it? If so, they should really consider using a measurement spoon or something so it's always consistent.
We gave this place so many chances but today we decided it's time to find a different ramen place. Not coming back ever again.
author: Trung V.

description:
BEST RAMEN! I ordered the spicy Mala and it was probably the best ramen I've had in a while. Spice level was just right, not too spicy and not too bland. My only comment is that the chicken karaage pieces were too big and I wasn't able to eat them because of that.
The spicy tuna roll was also very good. It was my first time eating raw fish.
I'd definitely come back here. Friendly and fast service. Good food. I highly recommend this place
author: Bianca M.

description:
Came here for a late lunch with my bf because we were looking for a quick lunch in the sunset. To our surprise, this place has a lotttt more than ramen! We both ended up ordering lunch special A, where you get a choice of ramen and a sushi roll with 6 pieces. We figured it was worth it because the combo itself is only $2 more and you get a small sushi roll! We both went with tonkatsu ramen, the bf got a california roll and I got a salmon and avocado roll. 

The sushi rolls came out first and they looked pretty standard. This isn't a sushi restaurant so you can't expect top notch fish or rolls. My salmon avocado roll was pretty good, the salmon was buttery, but the rice in the roll was kinda hard.. Same with the california roll that my bf ordered. Probably just old rice but bleh.

The ramen came out a few minutes after we finished the sushi rolls. Unfortunately I didn't yelp too much prior to ordering because I heard the spicy garlic tonkatsu is the popular choice at this place!! However I still enjoyed my tonkatsu broth. I like how they have the chili sesame oil and chili powder on the side to add to your broth. The broth had a pretty strong tonkatsu flavor which I liked, but when I was finishing, it got super salty and I couldn't finish the soup. I guess that is a common feat at a lot of ramen shops though. I liked the toppings on the ramen, it came with chasu pork, bamboo shoots, seaweed, wood ear mushrooms and green onions. The pork was okay, I like mine more tender. Bamboo shoots were super good!!! And the seaweed and mushrooms were a nice addition.

The food is okay, but the service is really quick. My bf and I were probably in and out in 20-30 minutes, and that's what I liked about this place. Also the donburi combos seem worth it! Maybe next time.
author: Tara A.

description: The ramen here is average. Not the best, but not the worst I've had. I would recommend the spicy garlic miso. You also get free sushi roll when you come here for lunch, but I'd skip it. I got the California roll and it tasted a bit sour. Wasn't an incredibly strong sour taste, but it was definitely there... has to drench my sushi in lots of soy sauce to cover up the sourness. Maybe if I was really craving ramen with no other place to go, I'd give this place a second try.
author: Whislie W.

description:
It seems like the quality of ramen here as gone down since my first couple of visits. The boyfriend and I came here for dinner a few days ago because I was craving something soupy. We were seated right away, and the service was really on-top of things -- asking if someone was getting us drinks, asked us if we were ready to order without us feeling pestered, etc. We both ordered the Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu, and I also got a small tekkadon because I was also craving sashimi. 

The tekkadon is SUPER small and is more don than tekka -- it came with 3 thinly sliced pieces of tuna, though it was fresh. Our ramen came, and the first thing we both noticed was that the noodles were overcooked. They were not al dente at all, and kind of reminded me of regular egg noodles... What a disgrace...Other than that, everything else tasted fine. I also underestimated the spiciness of the extra spicy, so I'll stick to medium next time (though it's kinda weird that it goes milk, medium, and extra spicy -- what happened to just spicy??).

This used to be one of my go-to ramen places, but after this visit (and discovering Waraku in Japantown) I probably won't be coming back...
author: Doris K.

description: I've been here a few times and every time has been a hit! Compared to other ramen joints, Saiwaii Ramen's soup broth is KILLER. I ordered the miso ramen which was equally creamy and flavorful (it also comes with corn MMM!). My bf ordered the spicy garlic tonkotsu which has a nice kick to it but isn't overly spicy! For the PRICE and PORTION, it's hard to pass up Saiwaii. I highly recommend stopping by before the dinner rush on weekends which usually start around 7!
author: Mary L.

description:
It's a very popular spot, so if you decide to have dinner here on a Saturday night expect some sort of wait. After 10-15 (depending on the party) we were seated so no complaints there. 

Any plate of ramen you decide to choose, I can guarantee you'll enjoy! I especially like adding extra pork belly ($4 more) but it's worth it! 

For appetizer get the Karage (fried chicken) and ask for extra Karage sauce.. Really good! We also ordered a Sawaii roll but I was not a big fan. Some people go here for sushi but I come here for the ramen! Well worth it!
author: Jezza Mei O.

description:
Eats: regular spicy garlic tonkatsu with pork belly (extra) and Alaskan salmon sushi roll

Takes: Finally tried the bf's favorite ramen place that he's been raving about during my most recent visit back to the city. Mmm that regular spicy garlic tonkatsu was on pointe! I'd definitely recommend that.

Spicy ramen comes in mild, regular, and spicy. The regular definitely has a kick; I didn't feel it until midway thru the meal when I needed to blow my nose and my lips were tingling. I'd recommend getting something to neutralize it like an appetizer or something. Noodle:broth ratio was okay. Granted I'm a noodle person, I wished there were more noodles to enjoy the broth. The broth was great--a great vehicle for the rich flavors of the veggies, meat, and seasonings. Also, don't forget the pork belly. Such tenderness and incredibly meaty. Yum! Definitely had a moment with my ramen and pork belly.

Alaskan salmon--the lemon slices on top makes the roll. It gives that extra oomf to the fresh sushi. This roll is a great complement to the spicy ramen; it gives your taste buds a break from the spicy flavors.

Service: Room for improvement. They didn't immediately give us a menu. If I was a regular, I wouldn't mind so much, but because this was my first time, I was itching to have the menu in hand. They were quick to do water refills. 

Ambiance: The locals know what's up. This place was packed on a memorial day Monday around 1pm. We waited a good 20-25mins for a party of 2.

Price: Bill came out to be around $48 (including tax, excluding tip) for a regular spicy tonkatsu with pork belly, regular spicy tonkatsu with pork belly and egg, and a Alaskan salmon sushi roll. It's on the expensive side for lunch, but boy are you stuffed by the end of it. We even took the leftover broth home!

Bottom line: Go here for your ramen fix!
author: Jash P.

description:
We got here before 6pm and were able to get seating. By 7pm it was full. The Lowell High track/cross country team had hosted a meet and 7 team members showed up for dinner. Those Teens have good taste. 
We like the tonkotsu broth ramen and I usually add corn. It is full of seaweed and other good stuff including thin slices of pork. Hubby added pork belly $1 and it came with 3 chunks.  
We also tried nigiri hamachi and butterfish. Both were tender and good, $4.50/pair. The appetizers came after the ramen arrived but our fried calamari $5 was also good with a spicy aioli sauce. Tentacles and rings included. Meal isn't entirely cheap, $37 before tax/tip.  I think for quality of food, it's the best in the area.
author: Ry T.

description: Spicy garlic tonkotsu soooo good! This place gets 4stars for being quick with their service and serving  really good ramen. Nothing special about it but they know how to cook it right. If you see a line outside, you're likely to wait more than 10 minutes. I'll definitely go back again. I'm already craving it(:
author: Camille B.

description: Saiwaii has tasty ramen and it's always steamy hot, just the way ramen should be. We often come here after a cold day at the park and we came here this past Sunday after our family run in the rain. It was the perfect place to warm up and slurp a bowl of noodles. The Spicy Miso is delicious but the Extra Spicy burns all your taste buds and is a bit too much. You can add a donburi to your $8 ramen for $4 and I think that's awesome value. I love their Braised Tofu with Vegetables and their sushi is pretty good too. Sawaii's only drawback is that it's really tight inside. Be prepared for the long wait but it's worth it. They have a large variety of dishes so you can cover all bases and they're all good. I've never had anything bad here and they've added an additional TV so everyone in your party can watch the game and eat.
author: Jen L.

description: I had the mild spicy garlic tonkotsu ramen. Mehhh. It was decent for a Japanese place close to my house but I've definitely had better. The bacon wrapped Mochi was actually pretty good. Smoked flavor but could have been cooked a little longer
author: Dylan L.

description: Came here for lunch & had their Seafood Ramen. It was so tasty (best ramen so far)...best seafood soup I've had.  Love this place!
author: Cris M.

description: Heard about this place from a friend, it was really good especially for the price. I am really into spicy food and my Ramen hit the spot. They have huge portions here definitely a spot to go back to as well as try for the first time. The karage was just as good, a nice crunch to it as well as a nice juicy inside. They also have a combination not a lot of people have tried before, Bacon and mochi. I was skeptical at first but after trying it makes me want to go get another one.
author: Garrett G.

description:
I give this restaurant 3.5 stars. They serve both ramen and sushi. I didn't try the sushi because it didn't look too appetizing. I tried the spicy garlic miso ramen with added egg. You can adjust the spicy level of which I opted for extra spicy. It had a slight kick but not as spicy as I expected. There wasn't too much pork but amount of noodles was decent. I would have hoped the noodles would be more chewy like others have noted. The ramen costs $7.95 but they list many add on toppings which will make it a bit higher in price.

Also, tried the bacon mochi which was ok. The bacon was too thick and would have preferred thinner slice. The chicken karaage was a bit dry but had a crispy all around.

I would come back here to satisfy my ramen craving but it wouldn't be my first choice for ramen in S.F.
author: James H.

description:
Date night! We wanted to get ramen and the closest place for us was Saiwaii. 

I've only had Saiwaii before just one time. I remember liking everything except for the pork belly cubes which I found to be too dense in fat. 

I've been trying to avoid meat so I sought out options for that. The only thing I could really order were the two tofu dishes, a meatless salad, edamame, and fried mushrooms which didn't look that appealing.

I had to double check the ramen. The menu states that the broths are all made with meat and veggies but when I asked the waitress if there was just vegetarian broth, I was told that the usual ramen flavors soy sauce, salt, miso have a meatless broth and that I can take meat out. I was told that the price would remain the same with or without meat so that was annoying. I also wasn't really convinced that the broth was without meat but I was hungry and didn't want to order a ton of small appetizers. 

The ramen was not very good flavor wise and was watery in taste compared to ramen I've had in the past. and adding different sauces and powders didn't help me at all. My boyfriend also tried some of my ramen and told me it was no where near as good as his ramen. Pretty sure it's because his was a lot more juicy than mine (with meat) but I was still disappointed. 

I wish Saiwaii had much better vegetarian options.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and didn't have to wait too long surprisingly. I ordered the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu Ramen and it was decent. Not one of the best ramens I've had but It definitely hit the spot and had a nice kick to it! I definitely recommend the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu it if you have a huge love for Garlic. The broth is really garlicy and it's probably a good idea to eat some mints afterwards.

The egg here is also surperb and definitely worth paying an extra dollar for! :)
author: MyTien P.

description: I feel like I come here to remind myself why I'm not a regular.  As with most places, I wish the portions were bigger.  How much would it really cost the business to put some more noodles in a bowl of ramen?!  We ordered three bowls, one for each of us, and I had mine plus Robert's bowl.  We got a side order of chicken karaage since the server said it would be more chicken than in the ramen.  The chicken was good, the broth was good, but for some reason, I feel like there were a lot of vegetables in the bowl.  I finished mine then Robert's and was still hungry.  :-/
author: ROB L.

description:
This place will appease the craving you had for ramen, but won't fully satisfy it. 

I got the tonkatsu and added the karaage. My friend and I shared the tuna poki salad and gyoza. Poki itself was fresh and taste good, but the salad was overly dressed. The gyoza weren't really anything to write home about and the dipping sauce wasn't very good. I opted to dunk the gyoza in my tonkatsu broth instead. The broth itself was lacking salt and that deep rich umami flavor that you'd expect. The broth also had a smokey burnt taste to it. I am guessing they burnt the bones and tried to mask the taste with too much pepper. The noodles had no tenacity and were pretty over cooked. Over cooked ramen is like getting a happy meal with no toy. It's a sad thing. Overall, just an okay ramen spot. I probably wouldn't wait in line for a table, but would go back if they weren't too busy.
author: Josh S.

description: Best ramen place in San Francisco so far. I'd always get the spicy garlic tonkatsu with corn. They have a variety of exotic appetizers too. The place is small so there will be wait but it's worth it
author: Julie n.

description:
Finally tried this ramen spot after years of passing by it and it's actually not bad. Ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen, chicken karaage, and calamari and they were all good. The broth of the ramen is decently rich and they give a reasonable serving of ramen too. 

Seems like this place gets busy and there may be a wait easily especially the small size of the restaurant. 

Definitely will come back and try their other ramen.
author: Lucy C.

description:
have been a customer for over 3 years. I come occasionally to this restaurant because I live nearby. 
Their service is great. Orders come in fast and the foods are really good!
author: Aaron S.

description:
Their Spicy Miso Ramen is the best thing this side of the city in my opinion. I seriously crave it if I go too long without a visit. I've tried a few other dishes but always go back to that!

The place is very small with limited seating though, so I recommend ordering for pickup or anticipating a wait. But it's definitely worth it!
author: Genevieve H.

description:
Came here after a hike with my friends and it was like one of the few places that were still open after 2pm and before 5pm.

Service: Friendly and attentive. 
Answered my questions, constantly check up on us and made sure to refill our water.

Food: Tasty and good portions.
I had the Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu and the soup base was pretty flavorful. It wasn't too salty, which was good. As for the ramen noodles, it was chewy and was not those spaghetti looking ones. (thank gosh) Most importantly, my eggs were perfectttt. Oh, and my friend had the Spicy Mala and she loved it! She can't stop complimenting it or comparing it to ours. Lol.

Recommend: Come here during their lunch hours! Their ramen special comes with choice of sushi. Yaaaass!!!

Overall, I'm so glad that I found this on yelp and decided to come here. It didn't disappoint me or my friends (first timers). Don't let the 3.5 stars stop you! Give this place a try! Definitely worth my time and will come back again. I wanted to rate it 4.5 stars, but yolo. Lol.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
I am by no means a ramen connoisseur, but Sawaii has some of the best I've had. Delicious, flavorful broth (that's not too salty), good amount of noodles, and they have lots of different ramen choices and add-on options. 

Favorite: Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu Ramen. I highly recommend adding corn! You have your choice of mild, regular, and extra spicy with this one. I like my dishes with some heat and the regular spicy is perfect. Extra spicy is borderline too much where I have to pace my bites...and I'd really prefer not to! 

Sushi is decent, but nothing to write home about. I'd skip it if you're on the fence about ordering any. Last time I was here I had the Alaskan roll, which is a CA roll with salmon and lemon on top. Lemon was a nice twist, but it came on a bit strong and overpowered the rest of the roll. 

Prices are on point at ~$8-10 for a bowl of hot steaming ramen, perfect for combating  a chilly night in SF. If there's a wait, be sure to sign the clipboard at the front. Even on a weekday night, the wait could be anywhere from 15-45 minutes for a table for 4. This joint is pretty small so prepare to cozy up to your neighbors a bit.  It's a little loud inside and not good for groups, but all in all, a solid option amongst the sea of Asian restaurants on Irving!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
The epic ramen I had at Nantsuttei in Tokyo's Ramen Alley made me a pretentious, spoiled ramen elitist. In a blink of an eye, or rather, a bite, I became a snarky critique of noodle pliancy, broth oiliness, and topping integrity.

TOTALLY UNFOUNDED. SOMEONE HELP ME REDISCOVER MY RAMEN HUMILITY.

Fortunately, time helped bring my sky-high standards back down to earth. Thank goodness for my incredible short-term memory for all things, whether it be about remembering ramen or your travels in Thailand. Point being, I'm going to need a refresher.

I ordered the MISO RAMEN, $7.95, which is noodles in a soy bean paste broth, topped with two slices of chashu pork, wakame (seaweed), negi (green onion), bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, and corn (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/saiwaii-ramen-san-francisco-3?select=FccMCWg7-EaSEN__d8CofQ#uMueN2GrUcITvippcCpxug).

Okay, so I can't quite shake all of my ramen elitism because Japan is big on hand-pulled noodles. Being a hand-pulled flour noodle fangirl, which are chewier and thicker, I wasn't a big fan of the thin egg noodles served here. But the noodles are firm and not clumpy, the miso soup is flavorful but not overly salty, and the ingredients are plentiful and fresh. Chashu pork was fairly generous for the regular bowl, and not overly fatty. The green onions are always appreciated, and the corn and bamboo shoots were unique additions.

My boyfriend ordered the SPICY GARLIC MISO RAMEN with chashu pork, wakame, negi, bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, and corn, $9.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/saiwaii-ramen-san-francisco-3?select=FccMCWg7-EaSEN__d8CofQ#g-FFnKlj1CGdmbeshmSqdg). Which meant that I didn't try his dish at all. You can choose from mild, regular, and extra spicy...but can you really trust a mild spicy miso!?

We also ordered the SAIWAII ROLL, which is 6 pieces of spicy tuna and crab topped with spicy scallops for $7.95 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/saiwaii-ramen-san-francisco-3?select=FccMCWg7-EaSEN__d8CofQ#FccMCWg7-EaSEN__d8CofQ). The roll had generous amounts of spicy tuna, and the spicy scallops on top had a pleasant, chewy texture. But, the fish were overpowered by the creamy, mayo-based sauce. Not surprising though.

I can't believe I called myself a hand-pulled flour noodle fangirl...I need some help.
author: Adele F.

description:
Worked out pretty hard befoee lunch and was craving some tonk. Definitely a slam dunk. 

Love this place. Tonk ramen is awesome. Service on point. Tea is free. They're super nice. It's definitely a hidden gem.
author: Anthony B.

description:
If you can't tell by my check-ins... I really like this place. LOL I've been here more than 10 times ( I just forget to check in ... ) but this place is the BOMB! 

The service here is pretty good. Seems like a family owned ramen place. When it gets busy it can be a little hard to get the waiters attention but thats with any busy restaurant. 

I'd definitely recommend the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen. If you dont like spicy then get mild!! The regular is ridiculously spicy! ( I can't handle spicy things so maybe im exaggerating LOL) Anyway, this is by far my favorite ramen in the city! I add corn and more meat because it only comes with two slices of cha su. (don't know if i spelled that correctly.. sorry!) The portions they give are a good amount and will make you full. I can barely finish the bowl on my own.

I've also tried the california roll and the spicy tuna roll. Both are pretty basic and not bad if you're craving either roll. They're a little small but pretty tasty. 

Overall this is a great place to go for ramen. Plenty of parking nearby and the food is sooo good !
author: Kelly S.

description: Excellent spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen, although it wasn't very spicy at all. It was however rich in flavor and the noodles were just the right amount of chewiness.  We were seated promptly and service was OK.  I'll have to try it again.
author: yoogles e.

description: First time visit to this establishment in the Sunset District in San Francisco. We came just in time as the restaurant was packed with a line out the door by the time my friend and I left. We both ordered their Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen. It was quite good, very spicy, with pork belly as well! We also ordered their Karaage Chicken (a little heavy with the batter), the Gyoza, and some Sushi. It was all good but not spectacular. We had hot tea to go with the dinner. The Ramen was good and very flavorful, not the best I've ever had but very good. All in all, it was a pleasant visit with a friend and an enjoyable dining experience. Nice neighborhood establishment. I would go again to try some of the other ramen dishes.
author: Norm D.

description:
I really wanted to try this place because I had been craving ramen lately. So, the bf and I came in right at 5PM on a Friday night. 

The bf had the chicken ramen and I ordered the spicy mala ramen and the volcano roll. Our food came out fairly quickly. 

The bf said his broth was very bland. It had no flavor at all. My broth was pretty mild. I would have rather had it a lot spicier. It also seemed a little too oily for my liking. The ramen noodles weren't overcooked, but I felt like the chicken karaage was. It was overly breaded. I didn't like it at all. 

The volcano rolls were average. The rolls seemed slightly smaller than they should for being a specialty roll. They tasted fresh though. 

Service was good. Our waitress was pretty attentive. Our total was about $40 including tip.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Came here for lunch with a couple friends, one who has been before and was raving about it. We tried a couple basic rolls and then each had ramen, I tried the spicy garlic tonkatsu and loved it! The broth was delicious and had spice, but I wouldn't say it was spicy. I would have liked it to be a bit spicier, but was definitely flavorful enough. 
Service was fast and food came out piping hot. 
Large portions of ramen, we all took some home!
author: Cheyenne N.

description:
- spicy garlic tonkotsu ramen is awesome
- the best soft boiled egg in ramen I've ever had!
- wide array of appetizers and sushi rolls for those that aren't into noodles
- broth could be a little thicker and more flavorful, but it's pretty decent already
author: Sherry L.

description:
When I first had Saiwaii back in 2010, I wasn't a big fan. It was just OK. I don't know why, but since then, I find myself coming back. Why? For another chance? Nah, it's probably because my BF likes coming here. ... sigh.

I usually get the spicy garlic tonkotsu. Added bonus is that they add fried garlic.. yum. 
I've tried the spicy garlic miso.. and it was the worst mistake ever. I didn't even know what I was eating. It didn't taste like miso at all. 
Karaage is always good, how can you mess up fried chicken, right?

I'll pass, but if ever my bf wants to come here, I know to stick with the spicy garlic tonkotsu. I've had to learn my lesson one too many times with the miso. sigh.
author: Leslie C.

description:
Even though parking on Irving can be tricky, this place has become my go-to ramen spot. There can be a wait sometimes, but the service is quick and you'd never wait an hour for a table. 

I always get the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu Ramen (mild) with soft boiled egg (+$1) and pork belly (+$3). It never fails! I love that the bowl comes out proportional. Just the right amount of noodles, broth and all the other ingredients. I never feel like they didn't give enough. They do, however, give a lot of pork belly. It's literally worth the extra $3. (And yes, I am complaining about how much pork belly they give... but in a good way)

I've also tried a bunch of their sushi rolls. They're worth getting as the fish is fresh and they're not overly stuffed with rice.

The service is great. The waitress is really nice and you don't have to ask a million times to get an extra napkin, more tea/water. And they'll check up on you when you're done eating before they just slap the bill on the table.

It's really small inside and sometimes elbow to elbow with the table next to you. But they do accommodate if you have a larger party than 2.

Another star because they have TV's and they'll always have whatever game is going on that night. (Best way to this sports lover's heart) :D
author: Liezel D.

description:
Oh Saiwaii Ramen. How have I not written a review about this place yet? Though I must say, I've been here more times than I've checked in AND posted pictures on IG of their ramen often (to make my friends drool over the awesomeness of their food). 
This is seriously my favorite ramen place in the bay area. I love their spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen. I always order it with an egg and pork belly. MMM their pork belly.....sooo much flavor and they aren't skimpy on the portions. (Thank goodness since you're paying extra for it!)
I've also enjoyed other dishes:
agedashi tofu: supper yummy and a nice light app before a heavy ramen bowl. 5 Stars
kare age: crispy and a good sized app. 4 Stars
croquette: yummy, wish the dish came with more pieces. 3 Stars
stuffed mushroom: yummy! 5 Stars
bacon asparagus: two good ingredients put together. 4 Stars
bacon mochi: kind of too chewy and hard for me. (The bacon mochi at Ippuku in Berkley is sooo damn good, it's made me a bit picky with this dish.) 2 Stars
author: Valeen C.

description:
I got to try the spicy garlic Tonkotsu ramen and it was surprisingly not as flavorful as I thought it would be. The broth was very thin and nearly spiceless. The garlic flavor doesn't diffuse into the broth very well so you can't really taste it unless you grab a spoonful of the garlic that sits on the bottom of the bowl. The pork meat had a very dry texture so it wasn't that enjoyable.

I tried their beef short ribs and it tasted pretty good, but it was very chewy and hard to eat.

The grilled mackrel was a bit hard and a little boring.

Overall, the price is okay, but there is a lot of room for improvement for their food.
author: Marco C.

description:
Came on a rainy Monday night - not too busy. Ordered the Tonkotsu ramen (Pork flavor with kikurage, Cha Shu, Menma, Wakame, Negi), 49er roll, and green tea. Everything was good. The ramen was perfect on that cold, rainy night. I wanted to try the ramen plain and plan to come back and order it with add-ons, like egg and the spicy garlic tonkotsu. 

Pros:
Ramen - piping hot and rich broth
Friendly and fast service

Con:
Parking may be difficult to find
author: Lola D.

description: I love this ramen place. Out of all the ones I've tried in SF and Berkeley, this one got me coming back for more. The first time I came here, I was so in love with the spiciness of their Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen, very spicy. However, the second time I came back put me in complete shock. It was so spicy that my stomach was churning for the two afters after my meal. But I'd have to mention this might be my fault since I'm the type to drink all the soup no matter how spicy it is. Regardless, portions are good, taste is great, service is awesome. It seems to be a family-run restaurant, which is great! Reasonable prices will keep me coming back for more!
author: Christine C.

description:
First time visitor.
Tonkatsu and spicy garlic tonkatasu ramen were ordered. The spice is evident if that is your preference. 
Flavorful and hearty. Reasonable price point.
You can add a mini donburi a few dollars so that is a nice addition.
The menu also includes rolls and other appetizer options.
Service is efficient but be mindful there are lines and if you have larger groups, a wait will be evident.
Worth a try and will visit again.
author: David H.

description: Had the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen(regular spicy). Loved it! Great flavor! Great spice! Probably one of the best in the bay area (comparing it to Ramen Parlor)
author: Amol D.

description: Came in during lunch and was lucky enough to get seating at this small ramen joint. The place filled up quickly. We ordered tonkatsu, the pork belly ramen. The broth was flavorful but I feel like I've had better. The pork belly itself was also okay but it could've been thinner, though that's just my preference. We also got a japanese fried chicken as an appetizer but the chicken itself was mediocre. It really needed the accompanying sauce to kick it up a notch.
author: Daniel J.

description: Ordered chicken noodle ramen and got a few pieces of chicken. Price: $12. Not worth the money.
author: David V.

description: My new favorite ramen spot in the city. The spicy garlic tonkatsu broth is just out of this world. Simply too orgasmic not to leave a 5 star review. Here's an extra tip -- don't forget to add egg and pork belly!
author: Amanda H.

description: Word to the wise: buy fresh miso ramen packs from Mitsuwa Market in Japantown, add your own pork, and it'd probably be better than Sawaii's ramen. This place depends on a captive Outer Sunset clientele and takes no pride in competing with downtown's better ramen spots.
author: Ken H.

description:
Apparently, I had this placed bookmarked for a while so since I was in the neighborhood, I decided to check it out for lunch.

Looking over the menu, I decided to get the spicy garlic tonkatsu ramen and a Sapporo. The broth was strong - in a good way - and the noodles had a solid texture. I was a bit disappointed there wasn't an egg, but oh well.

The service here is excellent. It looked like it was family run and the matriarch was making sure everyone was taken care of during lunch.

I will definitely be back.
author: Art O.

description:
I think their food just went downwire. Came here yesterday night with some friends and bf. I ordered the Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu--extra corn. My bf had the Spicy Miso with extra noodles and extra pork belly--that boy can eat. My two friends each had the Tonkatsu, one with extra noodles and Unagi Don. 

The unagi don does not look appealing, 2 slices of unagi in a small bowl of rice for $4.00? no way. The extra corn I ordered, there were barely any corn! Definitely do not order that since all the corn sinks in, get the egg instead.

Not too bad on a Wednesday night and we barely had to wait. I would probably come back.
author: Yuri Y.

description: Convenient and fast food if you live in the area, tastes average though. Ramen is better than donburi.
author: Olivia H.

description:
***Chicken Karage*** it's a must try.
I normally don't like fried food but it is so tender and juicy here.
Any ramen that i've ordered have been good so far.

*con* Place is small, so it isn't super comfortable for a long meal. I just try to do in and out.
author: Moto B.

description: Great casual ramen spot. Place was full on a rainy Tuesday at lunch. Very unpretentious which is appreciated as other SF ramen spots can be trying too hard and pretty over priced. This place is spot on. Spicy Garlic Tonk was really great. Flavorful broth, went with the mild just in case, but wasn't spicy really at all. Might get regular level of spice next time. The pork was particularly fatty which I don't prefer. Sushi was average. Not rolled very tightly which is just annoying. Gyoza was pretty good, would order again.
author: Anna M.

description:
If you're asking yourself if it's worth the wait....it's not!

  
We waited in the rain for about 30 minutes I usually order the spicy garlic tonkatsu and my friend ordered the same but got hers extra spicy.  They mixed our order up and gave me the extra spicy one.  Instead of remaking the order the waitress went to the kitchen and came back and said, "well I asked them and they didn't mix it up." I asked her to correct the order and instead she came back with plain broth for me to dilute the hot red bland soup.  That didn't work again and I asked her I'd she could give me the broth I ordered I could switch it but she kept bringing me plain broth.   I use to come here regularly and it's hit or miss.  The past few visits were a miss.
author: Jen J.

description:
DUDE SAIWAII.....stop using that cheap bacon shit for your chasu...once you use real chasu this rating will go up to a 5 because everything else is perfect.

Get the spicy garlic tonkatsu because thats the best of the best.  I think the karage is good too...don't get the beef tongue, the chunks are too big.

I really hope they read this review....
author: Vince L.

description:
Very cute ramen house with good lunch deals (e.g., ramen + 6-piece roll for ~$11).

The spicy garlic ramen (extra spicy) was actually spicy enough on its own (i.e., without doctoring) for the spicy-loving diner. The spicy tuna roll had more flavor than the spider roll, which had a well-executed tempura batter, but was otherwise uneventful.

Very pleasant staff and fellow diners!
author: Sarah A.

description: I haven't been here in a while but I came here last week with my bf. We were lucky enough to get a table 10 minutes before closing. My bf wanted to eat ramen and normally I would choose Izakaya Sozai over this place bc the broth is better over there. Anyways we thought it'd be a long line so we came here instead. We  both ordered the tonkotsu ramen with extra meat on the side. Honestly the quality went down...it use to be less salty and better but when I came here last week, it just wasn't amazing anymore. This is place is okay. Nothing amazing.
author: Monica W.

description:
This place can be a hit or miss. But mostly everytime I come here its a hit! I ALWAYS order the regular spicy garlic tokotsu.. Let me tell you, its AMAAAAAAAZING. All the flavors are on point and the perfect amount of spice. The texture of their noodles is perfect, the slices of meat is a little on the fatty side but hey, it adds flavor!! I also like to add corn and it adds a nice touch to the soup. I love it! I crave all the time lol.

Service is pretty good day and night. But either way, this place gets super packed!!
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great ramen! So savory and satisfying. Also the house specials like the braised pork and stir fried vegetables are delicious and don't break the bank. Would recommend to anyone looking for friendly service and filling grub.
author: Jad Q.

description: This place is great.  The ramen is outstanding, as are their appetizers and other items like sushi rolls.  I went to Izakaya Sozai, which is nearby, yesterday and think Saiwaii Ramen is quite a bit better.  It's also not as crowded either, which is great.  I will be a regular here.
author: M M.

description:
I have been wanted to come here forever. The line, the wait, the crowd and the tiny venue prevents me to dine here. Luckily Asian-friendly Irving Street has plenty of restaurants to satisfy me. 

While other people from the Sunset district are elsewhere at work, I came here for lunch after my gig near UCSF, which is down the hill. Of note: Irving Street is deserted with plenty of parking on the weekdays.

From the menu, there is a lunch combo for $11.95. I ordered one of the popular Ramen Soups; Spicy Garlic Tonkatsu Ramen. The other part of the combo is a choice of sushi, in which I chose the California Roll. The Ramen soup has tonkatsu, cha shu, seaweed, and fresh pasta in a spicy garlic-flavored broth. The ramen soup is the perfect remedy for this recent cold and chilly weather. The California Roll was good, despite me not much of a sushi-eater. I am not the one to judge.  My soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/saiwaii-ramen-san-francisco-3#O-A5ECGfAwI-IEF2rqMVoQ

My sushi: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/saiwaii-ramen-san-francisco-3#E2l2TU6keX6MWXCm9OUjNw

As I was enjoying my comforting meal, I was watching replay of a recent NBA game on one of the restaurant's televisions, which is my favorite sport. 

The lunch combo is definitely the deal here.
author: Matt G.

description:
This place is ok. Everything is bland! But at least it doesn't taste horrible. What else can I say? Nothing else.... other than the food is bland!

 And what?!?!?! No ramen egg? -_-
author: Chris R.

description: This place holds a lil spot in my heart with my sisters, as this is the ramen spot we always resort to when I'm in the area. Probably the place of my first real tonkotsu ramen as well. I love tonkotsu ramen and the flavors of their regular and spicy broths are so bold here that I often compare it to others, with saiwaii being the higher one. Though at times I am not impressed with the texture of their noodles, they tend to nail everything else down which does the job for me. Missing it from SoCal. I'll be back someday!
author: Krysta M.

description: Solid place to get your ramen fix in the Outer Sunset. The food is decent every time I visit and I've never had a bad experience here. Service could be a little bit better though, but it also depends on whether or not it's busy. Do come during lunch hours though, they have a special which includes a bowl of ramen and a plate of sushi. Great deal! I'm not giving this place 5 stars because it's missing a little something. I will update when I find out what it is.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Not my favorite place in the city to get ramen. I thought I try this place out just to see how it is and I definitely had better. Fortunately for me I went at a time where there was no wait for seats so I was seated within 5 minutes. If the wait was any longer I would have been even more disappointed.

The broth was savory, but bland. It definitely did not feel like the broth had the attention to detail that other good ramen places had. The toppings were the usual, but nothing too fancy. Presentation of the ramen was not that great either. Overall it was just an underwhelming experience.

Usually if I go to a shop that says that they are a dedicated ramen shop, they do not have sushi on their menu. This place had sushi as well which should have told me that their ramen is not that good.
author: Moses L.

description:
My coworker talks about Saiwaii every single day that it has been driving me crazy.. I decided to shut him up by agreeing to go with him. I've been here twice.I've had to tonkatsu  ramen and the spicy tonkatsu garlic ramen.    


I have to admit that the spicy one maybe really spicy but it had more flavor compared to the regular ones.  Some of the ingredients that comes with the ramen are in japanese, so if you are allergic to anything like bamboo shots make sure they don't add it.  I love the spicy soft crab here but the portion for the dish is a little on a small side.  The agedashi tofu here was ok, I didn't like the batter for the tofu.  

This place overall is really modern.  They do have two TVs here, but they are both on different stations.  And the shows are complete opposite of each other.  I would love to come back here and try their other non-ramen items, such as their sushi and curries.
author: Belinda C.

description: The most underrated ramen place in SF! The lunch specials are a great deal, $11-12 for a full size bowl of ramen and a sushi roll - yum! The broth is delicious here, very rich and flavorful. I usually get the spicy garlic tonkatsu which is soo good! I forgot to keep a lunch receipt once for my work expenses and had to call to get a copy of the receipt. The manager was super helpful and patient in working with accounting to retrieve a copy for me. Service is amazing and food is incredible! I highly recommend this place for a no hassle, no waiting in line, ramen fix!
author: Natalie W.

description: For now, I'm giving 4 stars. We'll see if this will change after more visits. We came in at 6. Almost full, but we didn't have to wait at all and got a table. We had the spicy garlic and Mala (mild) ramen. An order of the rolls, forgot which one. Grilled short ribs as appetizer. The food came very quick. But the strange thing was the appetizer came after the entrees. Overall, the food is decent. My son had the regular spicy. He said it was spicy. I'm glad I ordered mild. The karaage that came with the ramen was good, but I wish they weren't in the soup but on a plate when it was served. I would have taken more pictures, but I didn't want my kids to complain of me taking too many pictures. They were too hungry to wait! lol There are already tons of pictures taken by other reviewers any way. Overall, everything was fine. I will definitely return.
author: The Black Cat C.

description:
Went on a Thursday night and there was no wait. 

We both got the spicy garlic tonkatsu. The ramen was pretty bland. It had little Umami flavor. 

My girlfriend had gotten the extra spicy and it was very very spicy. All she tasted was the spice and no flavor. She definitely underestimated the spicy level.  They could have made a mistake and put too much chili oil. Note she loves spicy food.

The serving size was good for the price and the service was fine. They kept filling is up with water probably because they knew how spicy the ramen was. 

It's a okay ramen place if you are in the area and craving ramen, but it's not my first choice.
author: Allen C.

description:
What a yummy solution to all your cold weather problems! Reasonably priced and well portioned, the mild Spicy Garlic Tonkotsu broth was deliciously creamy and had the perfect amount of spiciness for me, which is none. I especially loved the crispy garlic shavings that decorated the top! 

Super disappointed in the lack of egg or other toppings that are usually staple in most ramen though. Even more so in the rough and tough chashu pork which should be melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Instead, I went into battle trying to chew the meat into smaller pieces.
